Name: PTCH2SRV_TCONST
Description: Time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved pitch angle. Most models respond well to 0.5. May be reduced for faster responses, but setting lower than a model can achieve will not help.

Name: PTCH2SRV_RMAX_UP
Description: This sets the maximum nose up pitch rate that the attitude controller will demand (degrees/sec) in angle stabilized modes. Setting it to zero disables the limit.

Name: PTCH2SRV_RMAX_DN
Description: This sets the maximum nose down pitch rate that the attitude controller will demand (degrees/sec) in angle stabilized modes. Setting it to zero disables the limit.

Name: PTCH2SRV_RLL
Description: Gain added to pitch to keep aircraft from descending or ascending in turns. Increase in increments of 0.05 to reduce altitude loss. Decrease for altitude gain.

Name: PTCH_RATE_P
Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

Name: PTCH_RATE_I
Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: PTCH_RATE_IMAX
Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Name: PTCH_RATE_D
Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: PTCH_RATE_FF
Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

Name: PTCH_RATE_FLTT
Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Name: PTCH_RATE_FLTE
Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Name: PTCH_RATE_FLTD
Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Name: PTCH_RATE_SMAX
Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Name: Q_ENABLE
Description: This enables QuadPlane functionality, assuming multicopter motors start on output 5. If this is set to 2 then when starting AUTO mode it will initially be in VTOL AUTO mode.

Name: Q_ANGLE_MAX
Description: Maximum lean angle in all VTOL flight modes

Name: Q_TRANSITION_MS
Description: Transition time in milliseconds after minimum airspeed is reached

Name: Q_VELZ_MAX
Description: The maximum ascending vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

Name: Q_VELZ_MAX_DN
Description: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s going down. If 0, uses Q_VELZ_MAX value.

Name: Q_ACCEL_Z
Description: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

Name: Q_RC_SPEED
Description: This is the PWM refresh rate in Hz for QuadPlane quad motors

Name: Q_ASSIST_SPEED
Description: This is the speed below which the quad motors will provide stability and lift assistance in fixed wing modes. Zero means no assistance except during transition. Note that if this is set to zero then other Q_ASSIST features are also disabled. A higher value will lead to more false positives which can waste battery. A lower value will result in less false positive, but will result in assistance taking longer to trigger. If unsure then set to 3 m/s below the minimum airspeed you will fly at. If you don't have an airspeed sensor then use 5 m/s below the minimum airspeed you fly at. If you want to disable the arming check Q_ASSIST_SPEED then set to -1.

Name: Q_YAW_RATE_MAX
Description: This is the maximum yaw rate for pilot input on rudder stick in degrees/second

Name: Q_LAND_SPEED
Description: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

Name: Q_LAND_FINAL_ALT
Description: The altitude at which we should switch to Q_LAND_SPEED descent rate

Name: Q_TRAN_PIT_MAX
Description: Maximum pitch during transition to auto fixed wing flight

Name: Q_FRAME_CLASS
Description: Controls major frame class for multicopter component

Name: Q_FRAME_TYPE
Description: Controls motor mixing for multicopter component

Name: Q_VFWD_GAIN
Description: Controls use of forward motor in vtol modes. If this is zero then the forward motor will not be used for position control in VTOL modes. A value of 0.05 is a good place to start if you want to use the forward motor for position control. No forward motor will be used in QSTABILIZE or QHOVER modes. Use QLOITER for position hold with the forward motor.

Name: Q_RTL_ALT
Description: The altitude which QRTL mode heads to initially

Name: Q_RTL_MODE
Description: If this is set to 1 then an RTL will change to QRTL when within RTL_RADIUS meters of the RTL destination, VTOL approach: vehicle will RTL at RTL alt and circle with a radius of Q_FW_LND_APR_RAD down to Q_RLT_ALT and then transission into the wind and QRTL, see 'AUTO VTOL Landing', QRTL Always: do a QRTL instead of RTL

Name: Q_GUIDED_MODE
Description: This enables use of VTOL in guided mode. When enabled the aircraft will switch to VTOL flight when the guided destination is reached and hover at the destination.

Name: Q_ESC_CAL
Description: This is used to calibrate the throttle range of the VTOL motors. Please read https://ardupilot.org/plane/docs/quadplane-esc-calibration.html before using. This parameter is automatically set back to 0 on every boot. This parameter only takes effect in QSTABILIZE mode. When set to 1 the output of all motors will come directly from the throttle stick when armed, and will be zero when disarmed. When set to 2 the output of all motors will be maximum when armed and zero when disarmed. Make sure you remove all properllers before using.

Name: Q_VFWD_ALT
Description: Controls altitude to disable forward velocity assist when below this relative altitude. This is useful to keep the forward velocity propeller from hitting the ground. Rangefinder height data is incorporated when available.

Name: Q_LAND_ICE_CUT
Description: This controls stopping an internal combustion engine in the final landing stage of a VTOL. This is important for aircraft where the forward thrust engine may experience prop-strike if left running during landing. This requires the engine controls are enabled using the ICE_* parameters.

Name: Q_ASSIST_ANGLE
Description: This is the angular error in attitude beyond which the quadplane VTOL motors will provide stability assistance. This will only be used if Q_ASSIST_SPEED is also non-zero. Assistance will be given if the attitude is outside the normal attitude limits by at least 5 degrees and the angular error in roll or pitch is greater than this angle for at least Q_ASSIST_DELAY seconds. Set to zero to disable angle assistance.

Name: Q_MAV_TYPE
Description: This controls the mavlink type given in HEARTBEAT messages. For some GCS types a particular setting will be needed for correct operation.

Name: Q_OPTIONS
Description: Level Transition:Keep wings within LEVEL_ROLL_LIMIT and only use forward motor(s) for climb during transition, Allow FW Takeoff: If bit is not set then NAV_TAKEOFF command on quadplanes will instead perform a NAV_VTOL takeoff, Allow FW Land:If bit is not set then NAV_LAND command on quadplanes will instead perform a NAV_VTOL_LAND, Vtol Takeoff Frame: command NAV_VTOL_TAKEOFF altitude is as set by the command's reference frame rather than a delta above current location, Use FW Approach:Use a fixed wing approach for VTOL landings, USE QRTL:instead of QLAND for rc failsafe when in VTOL modes, Use Governor:Use ICE Idle Governor in MANUAL for forward motor, Force Qassist: on always,Mtrs_Only_Qassist: in tailsitters only, uses VTOL motors and not flying surfaces for QASSIST, Airmode_On_Arm:Airmode enabled when arming by aux switch, Disarmed Yaw Tilt:Enable motor tilt for yaw when disarmed, Delay Spoolup:Delay VTOL spoolup for 2 seconds after arming, ThrLandControl: enable throttle stick control of landing rate, DisableApproach: Disable use of approach and airbrake stages in VTOL landing, EnableLandResposition: enable pilot controlled repositioning in AUTO land. Descent will pause while repositioning. ARMVTOL: Arm only in VTOL or AUTO modes. CompleteTransition: to fixed wing if Q_TRANS_FAIL timer times out instead of QLAND.

Name: Q_TRANS_DECEL
Description: This is deceleration rate that will be used in calculating the stopping distance when transitioning from fixed wing flight to multicopter flight.

Name: Q_TRIM_PITCH
Description: This sets the compensation for the pitch angle trim difference between calibrated AHRS level and vertical flight pitch. NOTE! this is relative to calibrated AHRS trim, not forward flight trim which includes TRIM_PITCH_CD. For tailsitters, this is relative to a baseline of 90 degrees in AHRS.

Name: Q_FW_LND_APR_RAD
Description: This provides the radius used, when using a fixed wing landing approach. If set to 0 then the WP_LOITER_RAD will be selected.

Name: Q_TRANS_FAIL
Description: Maximum time allowed for forward transitions, exceeding this time will cancel the transition and the aircraft will immediately change to the mode set by Q_TRANS_FAIL_ACT or finish the transition depending on Q_OPTIONS bit 19. 0 for no limit.

Name: Q_THROTTLE_EXPO
Description: Amount of curvature in throttle curve: 0 is linear, 1 is cubic

Name: Q_ACRO_RLL_RATE
Description: The maximum roll rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

Name: Q_ACRO_PIT_RATE
Description: The maximum pitch rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

Name: Q_ACRO_YAW_RATE
Description: The maximum yaw rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

Name: Q_TKOFF_FAIL_SCL
Description: Scalar for how long past the expected takeoff time a takeoff should be considered as failed and the vehicle will switch to QLAND. If set to 0 there is no limit on takeoff time.

Name: Q_TKOFF_ARSP_LIM
Description: Airspeed limit during takeoff. If the airspeed exceeds this level the vehicle will switch to QLAND. This is useful for ensuring that you don't takeoff into excessively strong wind. If set to 0 there is no limit on airspeed during takeoff.

Name: Q_ASSIST_ALT
Description: This is the altitude below which quadplane assistance will be triggered. This acts the same way as Q_ASSIST_ANGLE and Q_ASSIST_SPEED, but triggers if the aircraft drops below the given altitude while the VTOL motors are not running. A value of zero disables this feature. The altutude is calculated as being above ground level. The height above ground is given from a Lidar used if available and RNGFND_LANDING=1. Otherwise it comes from terrain data if TERRAIN_FOLLOW=1 and comes from height above home otherwise.

Name: Q_ASSIST_DELAY
Description: This is delay between the assistance thresholds being met and the assistance starting.

Name: Q_FWD_MANTHR_MAX
Description: Maximum value for manual forward throttle; used with RC option FWD_THR (209)

Name: Q_BACKTRANS_MS
Description: Pitch angle will increase from 0 to angle max over this duration when switching into VTOL flight in a postion control mode. 0 Disables.

Name: Q_TRANS_FAIL_ACT
Description: This sets the mode that is changed to when Q_TRANS_FAIL time elapses, if set. See also Q_OPTIONS bit 19: CompleteTransition if Q_TRANS_FAIL

Name: Q_LAND_ALTCHG
Description: The maximum altitude change allowed during land detection. You can raise this value if you find that landing detection takes a long time to complete. It is the maximum change in altitude over a period of 4 seconds for landing to be detected

Name: Q_AUTOTUNE_AXES
Description: 1-byte bitmap of axes to autotune

Name: Q_AUTOTUNE_AGGR
Description: Autotune aggressiveness. Defines the bounce back used to detect size of the D term.

Name: Q_AUTOTUNE_MIN_D
Description: Defines the minimum D gain

Name: Q_A_SLEW_YAW
Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

Name: Q_A_ACCEL_Y_MAX
Description: Maximum acceleration in yaw axis

Name: Q_A_RATE_FF_ENAB
Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

Name: Q_A_ACCEL_R_MAX
Description: Maximum acceleration in roll axis

Name: Q_A_ACCEL_P_MAX
Description: Maximum acceleration in pitch axis

Name: Q_A_ANGLE_BOOST
Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

Name: Q_A_ANG_RLL_P
Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

Name: Q_A_ANG_PIT_P
Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

Name: Q_A_ANG_YAW_P
Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain.  Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

Name: Q_A_ANG_LIM_TC
Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

Name: Q_A_RATE_R_MAX
Description: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

Name: Q_A_RATE_P_MAX
Description: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

Name: Q_A_RATE_Y_MAX
Description: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

Name: Q_A_INPUT_TC
Description: Attitude control input time constant.  Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

Name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_P
Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

Name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_I
Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_IMAX
Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_D
Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_FF
Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

Name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTT
Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTE
Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTD
Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_SMAX
Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_P
Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

Name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_I
Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

Name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_IMAX
Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_D
Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

Name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_FF
Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

Name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTT
Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTE
Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTD
Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_SMAX
Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_P
Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

Name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_I
Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

Name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_IMAX
Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_D
Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

Name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_FF
Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

Name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTT
Description: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTE
Description: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTD
Description: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_SMAX
Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Name: Q_A_THR_MIX_MIN
Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Name: Q_A_THR_MIX_MAX
Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Name: Q_A_THR_MIX_MAN
Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Name: Q_LOIT_ANG_MAX
Description: Loiter maximum pilot requested lean angle. Set to zero for 2/3 of Q_P_ANGLE_MAX/Q_ANGLE_MAX. The maximum vehicle lean angle is still limited by Q_P_ANGLE_MAX/Q_ANGLE_MAX

Name: Q_LOIT_SPEED
Description: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

Name: Q_LOIT_ACC_MAX
Description: Loiter maximum correction acceleration in cm/s/s.  Higher values cause the copter to correct position errors more aggressively.

Name: Q_LOIT_BRK_ACCEL
Description: Loiter braking acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values stop the copter more quickly when the stick is centered.

Name: Q_LOIT_BRK_JERK
Description: Loiter braking jerk in cm/s/s/s. Higher values will remove braking faster if the pilot moves the sticks during a braking maneuver.

Name: Q_LOIT_BRK_DELAY
Description: Loiter brake start delay (in seconds)

Name: Q_M_YAW_HEADROOM
Description: Yaw control is given at least this pwm in microseconds range

Name: Q_M_THST_EXPO
Description: Motor thrust curve exponent (0.0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

Name: Q_M_SPIN_MAX
Description: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

Name: Q_M_BAT_VOLT_MAX
Description: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust).  Recommend 4.2 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

Name: Q_M_BAT_VOLT_MIN
Description: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust).  Recommend 3.3 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

Name: Q_M_BAT_CURR_MAX
Description: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

Name: Q_M_PWM_TYPE
Description: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot, brushed or DShot motor output

Name: Q_M_PWM_MIN
Description: This sets the min PWM output value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors

Name: Q_M_PWM_MAX
Description: This sets the max PWM value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors

Name: Q_M_SPIN_MIN
Description: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range.  Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

Name: Q_M_SPIN_ARM
Description: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range.  Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

Name: Q_M_BAT_CURR_TC
Description: Time constant used to limit the maximum current

Name: Q_M_THST_HOVER
Description: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

Name: Q_M_HOVER_LEARN
Description: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

Name: Q_M_SAFE_DISARM
Description: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed

Name: Q_M_YAW_SV_ANGLE
Description: Yaw servo's maximum lean angle

Name: Q_M_SPOOL_TIME
Description: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

Name: Q_M_BOOST_SCALE
Description: Booster motor output scaling factor vs main throttle.  The output to the BoostThrottle servo will be the main throttle times this scaling factor. A higher scaling factor will put more of the load on the booster motor. A value of 1 will set the BoostThrottle equal to the main throttle.

Name: Q_M_BAT_IDX
Description: Which battery monitor should be used for doing compensation

Name: Q_M_SLEW_UP_TIME
Description: Time in seconds to slew output from zero to full. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

Name: Q_M_SLEW_DN_TIME
Description: Time in seconds to slew output from full to zero. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change.  Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

Name: Q_M_SAFE_TIME
Description: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.

Name: Q_P_ACC_XY_FILT
Description: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

Name: Q_P_POSZ_P
Description: Position (vertical) controller P gain.  Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

Name: Q_P_VELZ_P
Description: Velocity (vertical) controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

Name: Q_P_VELZ_I
Description: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

Name: Q_P_VELZ_IMAX
Description: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

Name: Q_P_VELZ_D
Description: Velocity (vertical) controller D gain.  Corrects short-term changes in velocity

Name: Q_P_VELZ_FF
Description: Velocity (vertical) controller Feed Forward gain.  Produces an output that is proportional to the magnitude of the target

Name: Q_P_VELZ_FLTE
Description: Velocity (vertical) error filter.  This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

Name: Q_P_VELZ_FLTD
Description: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term.  This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D terms

Name: Q_P_ACCZ_P
Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

Name: Q_P_ACCZ_I
Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

Name: Q_P_ACCZ_IMAX
Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

Name: Q_P_ACCZ_D
Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

Name: Q_P_ACCZ_FF
Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller feed forward

Name: Q_P_ACCZ_FLTT
Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz

Name: Q_P_ACCZ_FLTE
Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz

Name: Q_P_ACCZ_FLTD
Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz

Name: Q_P_ACCZ_SMAX
Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Name: Q_P_POSXY_P
Description: Position controller P gain.  Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

Name: Q_P_VELXY_P
Description: Velocity (horizontal) P gain.  Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

Name: Q_P_VELXY_I
Description: Velocity (horizontal) I gain.  Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

Name: Q_P_VELXY_D
Description: Velocity (horizontal) D gain.  Corrects short-term changes in velocity

Name: Q_P_VELXY_IMAX
Description: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum.  Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

Name: Q_P_VELXY_FLTE
Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter.  This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

Name: Q_P_VELXY_FLTD
Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter.  This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

Name: Q_P_VELXY_FF
Description: Velocity (horizontal) feed forward gain.  Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

Name: Q_P_ANGLE_MAX
Description: Maximum lean angle autopilot can request.  Set to zero to use ANGLE_MAX parameter value

Name: Q_P_JERK_XY
Description: Jerk limit of the horizontal kinematic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target

Name: Q_P_JERK_Z
Description: Jerk limit of the vertical kinematic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target

Name: Q_TAILSIT_ENABLE
Description: This enables Tailsitter functionality. A value of 2 forces Qassist active and always stabilize in forward flight with airmode for stabalisation at 0 throttle, for use on vehicles with no control surfaces, vehicle will not arm in forward flight modes, see also Q_OPTIONS "Mtrs_Only_Qassist"

Name: Q_TAILSIT_ANGLE
Description: This is the pitch angle at which tailsitter aircraft will change from VTOL control to fixed wing control.

Name: Q_TAILSIT_ANG_VT
Description: This is the pitch angle at which tailsitter aircraft will change from fixed wing control to VTOL control, if zero Q_TAILSIT_ANGLE will be used

Name: Q_TAILSIT_INPUT
Description: This controls whether stick input when hovering as a tailsitter follows the conventions for fixed wing hovering or multicopter hovering. When PlaneMode is not enabled (bit0 = 0) the roll stick will roll the aircraft in earth frame and yaw stick will yaw in earth frame. When PlaneMode input is enabled, the roll and yaw sticks are swapped so that the roll stick controls earth-frame yaw and rudder controls earth-frame roll. When body-frame roll is enabled (bit1 = 1), the yaw stick controls earth-frame yaw rate and the roll stick controls roll in the tailsitter's body frame when flying level.

Name: Q_TAILSIT_VFGAIN
Description: This controls the amount of vectored thrust control used in forward flight for a vectored tailsitter

Name: Q_TAILSIT_VHGAIN
Description: This controls the amount of vectored thrust control used in hover for a vectored tailsitter

Name: Q_TAILSIT_VHPOW
Description: This controls the amount of extra pitch given to the vectored control when at high pitch errors

Name: Q_TAILSIT_GSCMAX
Description: Maximum gain scaling for tailsitter Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK options

Name: Q_TAILSIT_RLL_MX
Description: Maximum Allowed roll angle for tailsitters. If this is zero then Q_ANGLE_MAX is used.

Name: Q_TAILSIT_MOTMX
Description: Bitmask of motors to remain active in forward flight for a 'Copter' tailsitter. Non-zero indicates airframe is a Copter tailsitter and uses copter style motor layouts determined by Q_FRAME_CLASS and Q_FRAME_TYPE. This should be zero for non-Copter tailsitters.

Name: Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK
Description: Bitmask of gain scaling methods to be applied: Throttle: scale gains with throttle, ATT_THR: reduce gain at high throttle/tilt, 2:Disk theory velocity calculation, requires Q_TAILSIT_DSKLD to be set, ATT_THR must not be set, 3:Altitude correction, scale with air density

Name: Q_TAILSIT_GSCMIN
Description: Minimum gain scaling for tailsitter Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK options

Name: Q_TAILSIT_DSKLD
Description: This is the vehicle weight in kg divided by the total disk area of all propellers in m^2. Only used with Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK = 4

Name: Q_TAILSIT_RAT_FW
Description: The pitch rate at which tailsitter aircraft will pitch down in the transition from VTOL to forward flight

Name: Q_TAILSIT_RAT_VT
Description: The pitch rate at which tailsitter aircraft will pitch up in the transition from forward flight to VTOL

Name: Q_TAILSIT_THR_VT
Description: Throttle used during FW->VTOL transition, -1 uses hover throttle

Name: Q_TAILSIT_VT_R_P
Description: Scale from PID output to control surface, for use where a single axis is actuated by both motors and Tilt/control surface on a copter style tailsitter, increase to favor control surfaces and reduce motor output by reducing gains

Name: Q_TAILSIT_VT_P_P
Description: Scale from PID output to control surface, for use where a single axis is actuated by both motors and Tilt/control surface on a copter style tailsitter, increase to favor control surfaces and reduce motor output by reducing gains

Name: Q_TAILSIT_VT_Y_P
Description: Scale from PID output to control surface, for use where a single axis is actuated by both motors and Tilt/control surface on a copter style tailsitter, increase to favor control surfaces and reduce motor output by reducing gains

Name: Q_TAILSIT_MIN_VO
Description: Use in conjunction with disk therory gain scaling and Q_TAILSIT_DSKLD to specify minumum airspeed over control surfaces, this will be used to boost throttle, when decending for example, 0 disables

Name: Q_TILT_ENABLE
Description: This enables Tiltrotor functionality

Name: Q_TILT_MASK
Description: This is a bitmask of motors that are tiltable in a tiltrotor (or tiltwing). The mask is in terms of the standard motor order for the frame type.

Name: Q_TILT_RATE_UP
Description: This is the maximum speed at which the motor angle will change for a tiltrotor when moving from forward flight to hover

Name: Q_TILT_MAX
Description: This is the maximum angle of the tiltable motors at which multicopter control will be enabled. Beyond this angle the plane will fly solely as a fixed wing aircraft and the motors will tilt to their maximum angle at the TILT_RATE

Name: Q_TILT_TYPE
Description: This is the type of tiltrotor when TILT_MASK is non-zero. A continuous tiltrotor can tilt the rotors to any angle on demand. A binary tiltrotor assumes a retract style servo where the servo is either fully forward or fully up. In both cases the servo can't move faster than Q_TILT_RATE. A vectored yaw tiltrotor will use the tilt of the motors to control yaw in hover, Bicopter tiltrottor must use the tailsitter frame class (10)

Name: Q_TILT_RATE_DN
Description: This is the maximum speed at which the motor angle will change for a tiltrotor when moving from hover to forward flight. When this is zero the Q_TILT_RATE_UP value is used.

Name: Q_TILT_YAW_ANGLE
Description: This is the angle of the tilt servos when in VTOL mode and at minimum output. This needs to be set for Q_TILT_TYPE=3 to enable vectored control for yaw of tricopter tilt quadplanes. This is also used to limit the forwards travel of bicopter tilts when in VTOL modes

Name: Q_TILT_FIX_ANGLE
Description: This is the angle the motors tilt down when at maximum output for forward flight. Set this to a non-zero value to enable vectoring for roll/pitch in forward flight on tilt-vectored aircraft

Name: Q_TILT_FIX_GAIN
Description: This is the gain for use of tilting motors in fixed wing flight for tilt vectored quadplanes

Name: Q_TILT_WING_FLAP
Description: For use on tilt wings, the wing will tilt up to this angle for flap, transistion will be complete when the wing reaches this angle from the forward fight position, 0 disables

Name: Q_WP_SPEED
Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

Name: Q_WP_RADIUS
Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

Name: Q_WP_SPEED_UP
Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

Name: Q_WP_SPEED_DN
Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

Name: Q_WP_ACCEL
Description: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

Name: Q_WP_ACCEL_Z
Description: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

Name: Q_WP_RFND_USE
Description: This controls if waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following

Name: Q_WP_JERK
Description: Defines the horizontal jerk in m/s/s used during missions

Name: Q_WP_TER_MARGIN
Description: Waypoint Terrain following altitude margin.  Vehicle will stop if distance from target altitude is larger than this margin (in meters)

Name: Q_WVANE_ENABLE
Description: Enable weather vaning.  When active, the aircraft will automatically yaw into wind when in a VTOL position controlled mode. Pilot yaw commands overide the weathervaning action.

Name: Q_WVANE_GAIN
Description: This converts the target roll/pitch angle of the aircraft into the correcting (into wind) yaw rate. e.g. Gain = 2, roll = 30 deg, pitch = 0 deg, yaw rate = 60 deg/s.

Name: Q_WVANE_ANG_MIN
Description: The minimum target roll/pitch angle before active weathervaning will start.  This provides a dead zone that is particularly useful for poorly trimmed quadplanes.

Name: Q_WVANE_HGT_MIN
Description: Above this height weathervaning is permitted.  If RNGFND_LANDING is enabled or terrain is enabled then this parameter sets height AGL. Otherwise this parameter sets height above home.  Set zero to ignore minimum height requirement to activate weathervaning

Name: Q_WVANE_SPD_MAX
Description: Below this ground speed weathervaning is permitted. Set to 0 to ignore this condition when checking if vehicle should weathervane.

Name: Q_WVANE_VELZ_MAX
Description: The maximum climb or descent speed that the vehicle will still attempt to weathervane. Set to 0 to ignore this condition to get the aircraft to weathervane at any climb/descent rate.  This is particularly useful for aircraft with low disc loading that struggle with yaw control in decent.

Name: Q_WVANE_TAKEOFF
Description: Override the weather vaning behaviour when in takeoffs

Name: Q_WVANE_LAND
Description: Override the weather vaning behaviour when in landing

Name: RALLY_TOTAL
Description: Number of rally points currently loaded

Name: RALLY_LIMIT_KM
Description: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

Name: RALLY_INCL_HOME
Description: Controls if Home is included as a Rally point (i.e. as a safe landing place) for RTL

Name: RC_OVERRIDE_TIME
Description: Timeout after which RC overrides will no longer be used, and RC input will resume, 0 will disable RC overrides, -1 will never timeout, and continue using overrides until they are disabled

Name: RC_OPTIONS
Description: RC input options

Name: RC_PROTOCOLS
Description: Bitmask of enabled RC protocols. Allows narrowing the protocol detection to only specific types of RC receivers which can avoid issues with incorrect detection. Set to 1 to enable all protocols.

Name: RC10_MIN
Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: RC10_TRIM
Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: RC10_MAX
Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: RC10_REVERSED
Description: Reverse channel input. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this input channel.

Name: RC10_DZ
Description: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

Name: RC10_OPTION
Description: Function assigned to this RC channel

Name: RC11_MIN
Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: RC11_TRIM
Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: RC11_MAX
Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: RC11_REVERSED
Description: Reverse channel input. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this input channel.

Name: RC11_DZ
Description: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

Name: RC11_OPTION
Description: Function assigned to this RC channel

Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: RC12_TRIM
Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: RCMAP_ROLL
Description: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.  Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

Name: RCMAP_PITCH
Description: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.  Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

Name: RCMAP_THROTTLE
Description: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Warning APM 2.X: Changing the throttle channel could produce unexpected fail-safe results if connection between receiver and on-board PPM Encoder is lost. Disabling on-board PPM Encoder is recommended.  Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

Name: RCMAP_YAW
Description: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter.  Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

Name: RELAY_PIN
Description: Digital pin number for first relay control. This is the pin used for camera control.

Name: RELAY_PIN2
Description: Digital pin number for 2nd relay control.

Name: RELAY_PIN3
Description: Digital pin number for 3rd relay control.

Name: RELAY_PIN4
Description: Digital pin number for 4th relay control.

Name: RELAY_DEFAULT
Description: The state of the relay on boot.

Name: RELAY_PIN5
Description: Digital pin number for 5th relay control.

Name: RELAY_PIN6
Description: Digital pin number for 6th relay control.

Name: RLL2SRV_TCONST
Description: Time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved roll angle. Most models respond well to 0.5. May be reduced for faster responses, but setting lower than a model can achieve will not help.

Name: RLL2SRV_RMAX
Description: This sets the maximum roll rate that the attitude controller will demand (degrees/sec) in angle stabilized modes. Setting it to zero disables this limit.

Name: RLL_RATE_P
Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain.  Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

Name: RLL_RATE_I
Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain.  Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: RLL_RATE_IMAX
Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Name: RLL_RATE_D
Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Name: RLL_RATE_FF
Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

Name: RLL_RATE_FLTT
Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Name: RLL_RATE_FLTE
Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Name: RLL_RATE_FLTD
Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Name: RLL_RATE_SMAX
Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

Name: RNGFND1_TYPE
Description: Type of connected rangefinder

Name: RNGFND1_PIN
Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.

Name: RNGFND1_SCALING
Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts. For Maxbotix serial sonar this is unit conversion to meters.

Name: RNGFND1_OFFSET
Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

Name: RNGFND1_FUNCTION
Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

Name: RNGFND1_MIN_CM
Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

Name: RNGFND1_MAX_CM
Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

Name: RNGFND1_STOP_PIN
Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

Name: RNGFND1_RMETRIC
Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

Name: RNGFND1_PWRRNG
Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

Name: RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR
Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

Name: RNGFND1_ADDR
Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

Name: RNGFND1_POS_X
Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

Name: RNGFND1_POS_Y
Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

Name: RNGFND1_POS_Z
Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

Name: RNGFND1_ORIENT
Description: Orientation of rangefinder

Name: RNGFND1_WSP_MAVG
Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

Name: RNGFND1_WSP_MEDF
Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

Name: RNGFND1_WSP_FRQ
Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

Name: RNGFND1_WSP_AVG
Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

Name: RNGFND1_WSP_THR
Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

Name: RNGFND1_WSP_BAUD
Description: Desired baud rate

Name: RNGFND1_RECV_ID
Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

Name: RNGFND1_SNR_MIN
Description: Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

Name: RNGFND7_WSP_BAUD
Description: Desired baud rate

Name: RNGFND7_RECV_ID
Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

Name: RNGFND7_SNR_MIN
Description: Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

Name: RNGFND8_TYPE
Description: Type of connected rangefinder

Name: RNGFND8_PIN
Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input. When using analog pin 103, the maximum value of the input in 3.3V.

Name: RNGFND8_SCALING
Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts. For Maxbotix serial sonar this is unit conversion to meters.

Name: RNGFND8_OFFSET
Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

Name: RNGFND8_FUNCTION
Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

Name: RNGFND8_MIN_CM
Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

Name: RNGFND8_MAX_CM
Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

Name: RNGFND8_STOP_PIN
Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

Name: RNGFND8_RMETRIC
Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

Name: RNGFND8_PWRRNG
Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

Name: RNGFND8_GNDCLEAR
Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

Name: RNGFND8_ADDR
Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and DroneCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

Name: RNGFND8_POS_X
Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

Name: RNGFND8_POS_Y
Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

Name: RNGFND8_POS_Z
Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

Name: RNGFND8_ORIENT
Description: Orientation of rangefinder

Name: RNGFND8_WSP_MAVG
Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

Name: RNGFND8_WSP_MEDF
Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

Name: RNGFND8_WSP_FRQ
Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

Name: RNGFND8_WSP_AVG
Description: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

Name: RNGFND8_WSP_THR
Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

Name: RNGFND8_WSP_BAUD
Description: Desired baud rate

Name: RNGFND8_RECV_ID
Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

Name: RNGFND8_SNR_MIN
Description: Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

Name: RPM1_TYPE
Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

Name: RPM1_SCALING
Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

Name: RPM1_MAX
Description: Maximum RPM to report. Only used on type = PWM.

Name: RPM1_MIN
Description: Minimum RPM to report. Only used on type = PWM.

Name: RPM1_MIN_QUAL
Description: Minimum data quality to be used

Name: RPM1_PIN
Description: Which pin to use. Only used on type = PWM.

Name: RPM1_ESC_MASK
Description: Mask of channels which support ESC rpm telemetry. RPM telemetry of the selected channels will be averaged

Name: RPM2_TYPE
Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

Name: RPM2_SCALING
Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

Name: RPM2_MAX
Description: Maximum RPM to report. Only used on type = PWM.

Name: RPM2_MIN
Description: Minimum RPM to report. Only used on type = PWM.

Name: RPM2_MIN_QUAL
Description: Minimum data quality to be used

Name: RPM2_PIN
Description: Which pin to use. Only used on type = PWM.

Name: RPM2_ESC_MASK
Description: Mask of channels which support ESC rpm telemetry. RPM telemetry of the selected channels will be averaged

Name: RSSI_TYPE
Description: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

Name: RSSI_ANA_PIN
Description: Pin used to read the RSSI voltage or PWM value

Name: RSSI_PIN_LOW
Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_PIN_HIGH. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

Name: RSSI_PIN_HIGH
Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_PIN_LOW. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

Name: RSSI_CHANNEL
Description: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

Name: RSSI_CHAN_LOW
Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH

Name: RSSI_CHAN_HIGH
Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_CHAN_LOW

Name: SCHED_DEBUG
Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

Name: SCHED_LOOP_RATE
Description: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

Name: SCHED_OPTIONS
Description: This controls optional aspects of the scheduler.

Name: SCR_ENABLE
Description: Controls if scripting is enabled

Name: SCR_VM_I_COUNT
Description: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

Name: SCR_HEAP_SIZE
Description: Amount of memory available for scripting

Name: SCR_DEBUG_OPTS
Description: Debugging options

Name: SCR_USER1
Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

Name: SCR_USER2
Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

Name: SCR_USER3
Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

Name: SCR_USER4
Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

Name: SCR_USER5
Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

Name: SCR_USER6
Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

Name: SCR_DIR_DISABLE
Description: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

Name: SERIAL0_BAUD
Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL0_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol to use on the console.

Name: SERIAL1_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

Name: SERIAL1_BAUD
Description: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL2_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

Name: SERIAL2_BAUD
Description: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL3_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol Serial 3 (GPS) should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

Name: SERIAL3_BAUD
Description: The baud rate used for the Serial 3 (GPS). Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL4_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol Serial4 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

Name: SERIAL4_BAUD
Description: The baud rate used for Serial4. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL5_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol Serial5 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

Name: SERIAL5_BAUD
Description: The baud rate used for Serial5. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL6_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol Serial6 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

Name: SERIAL6_BAUD
Description: The baud rate used for Serial6. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL1_OPTIONS
Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

Name: SERIAL2_OPTIONS
Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

Name: SERIAL3_OPTIONS
Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

Name: SERIAL4_OPTIONS
Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

Name: SERIAL5_OPTIONS
Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

Name: SERIAL6_OPTIONS
Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

Name: SERIAL_PASS1
Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

Name: SERIAL_PASS2
Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

Name: SERIAL_PASSTIMO
Description: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

Name: SERIAL7_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol Serial7 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

Name: SERIAL7_BAUD
Description: The baud rate used for Serial7. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL7_OPTIONS
Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

Name: SERIAL8_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol Serial8 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

Name: SERIAL8_BAUD
Description: The baud rate used for Serial8. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL8_OPTIONS
Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

Name: SERIAL9_PROTOCOL
Description: Control what protocol Serial9 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

Name: SERIAL9_BAUD
Description: The baud rate used for Serial8. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

Name: SERIAL9_OPTIONS
Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

Name: SERVO_AUTO_TRIM
Description: This enables automatic servo trim in flight. Servos will be trimed in stabilized flight modes when the aircraft is close to level. Changes to servo trim will be saved every 10 seconds and will persist between flights. The automatic trim won't go more than 20% away from a centered trim.

Name: SERVO_RATE
Description: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

Name: SERVO_DSHOT_RATE
Description: This sets the DShot output rate for all outputs as a multiple of the loop rate. 0 sets the output rate to be fixed at 1Khz for low loop rates. This value should never be set below 500Hz.

Name: SERVO_DSHOT_ESC
Description: This sets the DShot ESC type for all outputs. The ESC type affects the range of DShot commands available. None means that no dshot commands will be executed.

Name: SERVO_GPIO_MASK
Description: This sets a bitmask of outputs which will be available as GPIOs. Any auxillary output with either the function set to -1 or with the corresponding bit set in this mask will be available for use as a GPIO pin

Name: SERVO10_MIN
Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO10_MAX
Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO10_TRIM
Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO10_REVERSED
Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

Name: SERVO10_FUNCTION
Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

Name: SERVO11_MIN
Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO11_MAX
Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO11_TRIM
Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO11_REVERSED
Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

Name: SERVO11_FUNCTION
Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO15_REVERSED
Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

Name: SERVO15_FUNCTION
Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

Name: SERVO16_MIN
Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO16_MAX
Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO16_TRIM
Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

Name: SERVO16_REVERSED
Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

Name: SERVO_BLH_MASK
Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

Name: SERVO_BLH_AUTO
Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

Name: SERVO_BLH_TEST
Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

Name: SERVO_BLH_TMOUT
Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

Name: SERVO_BLH_TRATE
Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

Name: SERVO_BLH_DEBUG
Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

Name: SERVO_BLH_OTYPE
Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

Name: SERVO_BLH_PORT
Description: This sets the mavlink channel to use for blheli pass-thru. The channel number is determined by the number of serial ports configured to use mavlink. So 0 is always the console, 1 is the next serial port using mavlink, 2 the next after that and so on.

Name: SERVO_BLH_POLES
Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

Name: SERVO_BLH_3DMASK
Description: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

Name: SERVO_BLH_BDMASK
Description: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.

Name: SERVO_BLH_RVMASK
Description: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

Name: SERVO_FTW_MASK
Description: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

Name: SERVO_FTW_RVMASK
Description: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

Name: SERVO_FTW_POLES
Description: Number of motor electrical poles

Name: SERVO_ROB_POSMIN
Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

Name: SERVO_ROB_POSMAX
Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

Name: SERVO_SBUS_RATE
Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

Name: SERVO_VOLZ_MASK
Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

Name: SOAR_ENABLE
Description: Toggles the soaring mode on and off

Name: SOAR_VSPEED
Description: Rate of climb to trigger themalling speed

Name: SOAR_Q1
Description: Standard deviation of noise in process for strength

Name: SOAR_Q2
Description: Standard deviation of noise in process for position and radius

Name: SOAR_R
Description: Standard deviation of noise in measurement

Name: SOAR_DIST_AHEAD
Description: Initial guess of the distance to the thermal center

Name: SOAR_MIN_THML_S
Description: Minimum number of seconds to spend thermalling

Name: SOAR_MIN_CRSE_S
Description: Minimum number of seconds to spend cruising

Name: SOAR_POLAR_CD0
Description: Zero lift drag coefficient

Name: SOAR_POLAR_B
Description: Induced drag coeffient

Name: SOAR_POLAR_K
Description: Cl factor 2*m*g/(rho*S)

Name: SOAR_ALT_MAX
Description: Don't thermal any higher than this.

Name: SOAR_ALT_MIN
Description: Don't get any lower than this.

Name: SOAR_ALT_CUTOFF
Description: Cut off throttle at this alt.

Name: SOAR_MAX_DRIFT
Description: The previous mode will be restored if the horizontal distance to the thermalling start location exceeds this value. -1 to disable.

Name: SOAR_MAX_RADIUS
Description: RTL will be entered when a thermal is exited and the plane is more than this distance from home. -1 to disable.

Name: SOAR_THML_BANK
Description: This parameter sets the bank angle to use when thermalling. Typically 30 - 45 degrees works well.

Name: SOAR_THML_ARSPD
Description: If non-zero this airspeed will be used when thermalling.

Name: SOAR_CRSE_ARSPD
Description: If non-zero this airspeed will be used when cruising. If set to -1, airspeed will be selected based on speed-to-fly theory.

Name: SOAR_THML_FLAP
Description: This sets the flap when in LOITER with soaring active. Overrides the usual auto flap behaviour.
